body.name: Image in a Cracked Mirror: A Violet Darger Novella (Violet Darger FBI Mystery Thriller)
body.description: A family has been massacred in their home, a display of violence both brutal and bizarre. The details prove curious -- not only are the bodies savaged way beyond anything found at a normal murder scene, every mirror in the house has been shattered. The spectacle shocks a peaceful island community, and when local police turn to the FBI for assistance, Agent Violet Darger finds herself working another harrowing crime scene. She stares, once more, into the abyss, and mankind's warped reflection stares back. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars "I needed more blood or I'll die."
reviews.reviewText: Violet Drager is back with Loshak in a wonderfully gruesome novella that will have you guessing who did it. Based on a real murder, this story will have feeling like you are there with Violet as she solves this new case. From first reviewing the stomach turning photos, touring the heartbreaking murder scene then interviewing the suspects. The confession of the killer of why he did the murder is the most horrifying part of the the book for me. " I needed more blood or I'll die. " This story will keep you turning pages until you are shocked to find it's over way too soon.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 24, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: A short, sharp, shockingly good story
reviews.reviewText: This has to be the darkest Darger and Loshak story so far. Based on real events, this gets straight to the nitty gritty and envelops the reader in the gruesome details of the crime scene, keeping you off balance but hooked from start to finish.The light hearted banter has been replaced by quiet reflection, and the intense understanding between the two partners is a testament to their ever growing relationship.This intensely powerful story packs a punch that other writers would not be able to achieve in a book much longer than this, proving once again that L.T. Vargus and Tim McBain have it down when it comes to delivering the goods.If you have never read anything by these authors, you could do worse than start here, especially at just 99p.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 26, 2021
reviews.reviewText: A short and sweet novella that sees Violet Darger reunited with Victor Loshak, the FBI' s leading profiler. Based on an actual case the story is focused on our two central characters interviewing three suspects in a multiple murder. As a result of their teamwork Loshak invites Darger to transfer to the unit within the Bureau, thereby setting the scene for the remainder of the series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on December 8, 2019
reviews.reviewText: Brilliant story Violet is getting in her stride now. Are we going to have some good stories from now on. Following Violet through her turbulent work across the U.S.A These stories feel real, so to let the reader think that is some accomplishment. Once starting to read any of the books it is very hard to put them down until finished. I take my hat off to the two writers.
